title: August 2022 Records Request Multi-Agency Response to Stamford, VT Property

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: August 2022 Records Request Multi-Agency Response to Stamford, VT Property
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records held by the Vermont Department for Children and Families (DCF) concerning the investigation and its resolution involving an Ezra M. Miller’s property in Stamford, Vermont in August 2022, as chronicled in the Rolling Stone article titled 'The Ezra Miller Saga Now Involves Vermont’s Child Services Department' (published August 10, 2022, available at: https://web.archive.org/web/20241215093133/https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-news/ezra-miller-vermont-child-services-department-1392572/). 
The article details attempts by Vermont State Police to serve an emergency care order on August 6, 7, and 9, 2022, at a 96-acre farm in Stamford, intended to remove a 25-year-old mother and her three children amid reported welfare concerns, with DCF overseeing the inquiry and potential involvement of the Vermont Attorney General’s Office in legal proceedings. Notably, the article includes a quote from an individual suggesting the property owner was attempting to "avoid" or conceal matters related to the investigation, raising additional questions about the events.  

Specifically, I seek the following records from August 6, 2022, through December 31, 2023:  

DCF Investigation Records:
Reports, case notes, or findings related to the welfare of the mother and her three children at the Stamford property, including any assessments or investigations prompting the emergency care order issued in August 2022; plus any follow-up records documenting the resolution or subsequent actions taken regarding their welfare after August 9, 2022.  

Correspondence and Legal Coordination:
Correspondence (e.g., emails, memos, or letters) between DCF and Vermont State Police or the Vermont Attorney General’s Office regarding the emergency care order, its execution, or its outcome; records of any hearing referenced in the article scheduled on or after August 11, 2022, including notices, outcomes, or related communications.  

Inter-Agency Coordination:
Documentation of DCF’s oversight or coordination with Vermont State Police and the Vermont Attorney General’s Office concerning the welfare of the mother and her three children or the execution of the emergency care order; if any responsive records are held by other agencies (even out-of-state agencies), I request coordination with that agency or referral of my request to the appropriate agency to ensure relevant obtainable documents are obtained.

I request that any exempt personal information (e.g., names of minors or private individuals) be redacted rather than withholding documents entirely, consistent with the Vermont Public Records Act’s presumption of disclosure (1 V.S.A. § 315 et seq.).
I am not affiliated with any news agencies & this request is not being made for commercial purposes. This inquiry serves the public interest by shedding light on the resolution of a widely publicized matter (yet for some reason never followed up on by news organizations) involving child welfare and inter-agency action, fostering transparency in governmental proceedings, and discouraging vigilante justice from members of the public who, due to rampant disinformation by omission, might be inclined to take matters into their own hands against a perceived child abductor.

If there are any issues with the scope or specificity of this request, please contact me to discuss it before denying or delaying the response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PJ

title: Wayne County Opioid Settlement Fund Request

communications.communication:
Johnathan Edwards 
2040 University Avenue- Apartment 301
Morgantown, WV 26505

02/24/2025

Craig Evans
Wayne County Clerk
Clerk’s Office of Wayne County
700 Hendricks Street
Wayne, WV 25570

Dear Mr. Evans: 

Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that show the following; Allocation of opioid settlement funds received by Wayne County, the application that individuals or organizations seeking funding from the county complete, copies of grant applications from individuals or organizations that have been approved to receive these funds, the individuals who will review the funding applications, any meeting minutes of county-level officials where the receiving or distribution of county-level opioid settlement funding was discussed, and how much funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded. If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how this large sum of allocated funds is being distributed across the county. I am a student reporter at West Virginia University and intend to use this information to more accurately report on these findings. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. You can call me at 304-638-6367 or send me an email at jde00006@mix.wvu.edu My physical address is 2040 University Ave. Morgantown, WV, 26505.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Milo Perkins
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Milo Randolph Perkins (1900-1972). Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: COCASE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Files 64-HQ-20026 and 65-NY-12479, captioned "COCASE", on Dieudonne Costes (aka "Tom X")  (November 14, 1892 - May 18, 1973) and Mary Costes (aka Marie Costes, "Mrs. Tom X") who were recruited by the FBI in 1942 to act as double agents against German intelligence during World War II, passing along false aviation information, boosted by Dieudonne's status as an ace pilot during World War I. Costes was handled by Robert A. Maheu under the alias "Robert A. Marchand". This case led to the conviction of Paul Jean Marie Cavallier (aka "John Y") on espionage charges. Proof of death is not required as Dieudonne Costes' date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Eviction lockout notices January 2019 thru present day (Passaic County Sheriff)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a list of eviction notices served specifically in Paterson from the 'eviction list' compiled by the Passaic County Sheriff's Office between January 2019 and the latest available data. Please provide this information in a machine-readable spreadsheet format, such as Excel or CSV. The dataset should include, but not be limited to, the following fields:
- file number 
- occupants
- address 
- restoration date
- status 
- court case number 
- Indicates type of process served or posted 
- Indicates manner of service (personally served or posted and mailed) 
- Indicates status of notice (cancelled, unsuccessful-no show, unsuccessful-took peaceful possession, unsuccessful-not found)

I would like to reiterate that I am seeking all fields containing non-exempt information about the Passaic County Sheriff’s Office’s eviction notices. That means fields containing the above information, and fields containing any additional information not listed, but that would still be disclosable under the law

title: Nevada Inmates Wages While Fighting Fires

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Nevada Inmates Wages While Fighting Fires
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1). The number of inmates/offenders from the Nevada Department of Corrections that received training to fight wildfires from January 2019 - December 2024, and the total costs associated with that program. 
2). The wages of Nevada inmates/offenders for that were fighting fires from January 2019-December 2024, including information on race, age, gender and convicted crime but eliminating other private information.
3). The amount of money received into the Division of Forestry Account as outlined in NRS 209.231, reflecting money which is obtained from the operation of a conservation camp and which is not used for salaries, overhead or operating expenses of any conservation camp is required to be deposited in the Division of Forestry Account. 
4). The State Forestry Firewarden's determination of wages that must be paid to inmates/ offenders in the years 2019-2024 in accordance to  NRS 472.040h.
5). The contract between California Division of Forestry and the Nevada Department of Corrections pertaining to financial agreements for use of Nevada's Inmates / Offenders from January 2019-December 2024.
6). All contracts and bills from the Humboldt Conservation Camp regarding the 2011 "general clean up" cooperated by a Stor-Al location in Winnemuca as found in Appendix A in https://www.leg.state.nv.us/Division/Audit/Full/BE2014/Division%20of%20Forestry,%20LA14-01%20Full.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

michelle baker

title: Information on actions taken and plans to comply with OPM DEIA guidance

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background: 

On January 29, 2025 and February 5, 2025, Charles Ezell, Acting Director, U.S. Office of Personnel Management, sent memos to all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies entitled "Initial Guidance Regarding DEIA Executive Orders" and "Further Guidance Regarding Ending DEIA Offices, Programs and Initiatives," respectively. Amongst other things, the memos instructed all Heads and Acting Heads of Departments and Agencies to prepare reports to be sent to DEIAreports@opm.gov, and that generally, "agencies should terminate all illegal DEIA initiatives, [...] policies, programs, and practices."

Pursuant to the the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) A complete list of actions taken in response to the above two OPM memos.

2.) A copy of any agency plans to fully comply with the above two OPM memos.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 days.

Sincerely,

Daisy McDonald

title: Plans concerning reduction in budget for FY26 and RIF of workforce

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Plans concerning reduction in budget for FY26 and RIF of workforce
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) Information regarding plans created on or after January 20, 2025 to reduce the budget of NSF in financial year 2026 (FY26), including:

1a.) Internal reports, memorandums, meeting minutes, or directives generated or received by the National Science Board or the Office of the Director concerning reductions to the overall budget of NSF in FY26, created on or after January 20, 2025.

1b.) E-mails including attachments sent on or after January 20, 2025 broadly to all division directors, or to all division directors in a directorate, concerning reductions to the overall budget of NSF in FY26.

2.) Information regarding planned or executed layoffs (reduction in force processes or RIF) on or after January 20, 2025 at NSF, including:

2a.) Internal reports, memorandums, meeting minutes, or directives generated or received by the National Science Board or the Office of the Director regarding planned or executed layoffs at NSF, created on or after January 20, 2025.

2b.) E-mails including attachments sent on or after January 20, 2025 broadly to all division directors, or to all division directors in a directorate, regarding layoffs at the NSF or layoffs of division directors.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I am willing to pay fees regarding my request provided I have received information on the total charges. title: Documentation of keyword-based vetting process of active awards initiated on or after January 20, 2025

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Documentation of keyword-based vetting process of active awards initiated on or after January 20, 2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background:

Around roughly January 30 and thereafter, several news organizations (including Washington Post, ScienceInsider, Nature's news division) began reporting that NSF employees were reviewing or vetting existing awards based off of a list of keywords relevant to recent executive orders. Among other things, the reporting described the process by which these grants were vetted along with specific documents associated to this process, which primarily the information sought in this request.

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1.) A complete list or a document including such a list of keywords used in this vetting process, which should have been created on or after January 20, 2025. To assist in finding such a list, keywords/phrases released by news organizations included: advocacy, antiracist, barrier, biases, cultural relevance, disability, diverse backgrounds, diversity, diversified, ethnicity, excluded, exclusion, equity, female, gender, hate speech, historically, implicit bias, inclusion, inclusive, inequalities, institutional, intersectional, male dominated, marginalized, minority, multicultural, oppression, polarization, racially, segregation, systemic, trauma, underrepresented, underserved, victims, women.

2.) Information about a vetting process that concerned that list of keywords and active awards, and which was undertaken after January 20, 2025, and at least between but not limited to February 3-7, 2025, including:

2a.) Internal documents regarding this keyword vetting process such as reports, memorandums, meeting minutes, or notes, including but not limited to: a flowchart used to evaluate whether a research project should be flagged for further review, an internal email sent as an update clarifying "edge cases" concerning flagged awards that may be in violation of policies, a document or communications containing the criteria for flagging grants and what to look for (such as "discriminatory programs, including illegal DEI") sent to or intended for program officers.

2b.) The complete list or relevant spreadsheets of awards initially selected by NSF senior managers for vetting by NSF employees, said to have numbered at around 10,000 out of 50,000 active awards.

2c.) The complete list or relevant spreadsheets of awards after the initial stage in the vetting process allegedly flagged to contain two or more keywords, said to have numbered at around 1,200 awards. The spreadsheets in question may have been supposed to be finalized on February 3, 2025 at 5:00 pm.

2d.) The complete list or relevant spreadsheets of awards remaining after the final step in the vetting process, including if available any actions or proposed actions (such as termination) against these grants. The spreadsheets in question may have been supposed to be finalized on February 7, 2025.

2e.) Any documents or communications generated by the Office of the Director on or after February 7, 2025 concerning the final decision of the awards remaining after the final step in the vetting process, including written justifications for grant cancellations or modifications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If the requested information requires relevant persons identities to not be disclosed (such as employee reviewers), please add redactions to the records wherever required.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I am willing to pay fees regarding my request provided I have received information on the total charges. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daisy McDonald

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: South Alabama FRS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the NCAA Membership Financial Reporting System revenue and expense reports for fiscal (or reporting) years 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024.  Specifically:  

These reports are completed by the athletic department for the National Collegiate Athletic Association for the fiscal years listed above. This report is a multi-page document that had to be submitted to the NCAA in January. It contains 40+ revenue and expense categories, followed by specific breakdowns of each of those categories, by sport and gender. I am requesting the full report, including the detail tables, the “Other Reporting Items” list and the “Statement of Revenues and Expenses” that appears at the end of the report. PLEASE NOTE: The NCAA report is different than the equity report that is sent to the U.S. Department of Education for Title IX compliance.

I prefer to receive the records electronically as an Adobe Acrobat (.pdf) file.

If you choose to deny this request, please provide a written explanation for the denial including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) on which you rely.  Also, please provide all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Stacey Brook.

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for all counties in Colorado for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the Dominion voting system. An example of these records in REDACTED format is available at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency

If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.) I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

My request belongs in the educational category, as it pertains to my obligations as a researcher and PhD Candidate at Harvard University, and I am filing this request in pursuit of advancing knowledge and research on voter behavior.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: Thank you for contacting our office
communications.communication:
If you need to update your voter registration, you can do so online by visiting www.GoVoteColorado.gov<http://www.GoVoteColorado.gov>.

If you need to mail a voter registration form, we recommend sending it directly to your county clerk and recorder. County contact information is available on our website at https://www.coloradosos.gov/pubs/elections/Resources/CountyElectionOffices.html.

We’ll respond to your inquiry as quickly as possible.

Thank you.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: CLE II
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing the proposed floorplan, cost, and related information for the Center for Leadership and Ethics Phase II, described as "this 66,144 square foot facility will bring together portions of the Leadership Development Program and the VMI Museum in a new facility,
allowing opportunities to share resources, collaborate on programming, and grow the VMI leadership development experience for leaders at all levels with focus on the Corps of Cadets. The facility will include classrooms and auditorium, group collaboration areas, museum display spaces, interactive learning venues, storage space, office space, catering space, and general support spaces." To include, without limitation the space and square footage allocated to the VMI museum and the planned utilization of the parking garage (staff, faculty, cadets, public, etc. If cadets, how many parking spaces are allocated to them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Evergreen Solutions (Rockland Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:


Subject: Request for Public Records - 

Greetings,

I hope this email finds you well. We at Evergreen Solutions, LLC, are conducting a compensation study on behalf of our client and I am writing to make a formal open records request. We are requesting an electronic copy of your staff and faculty (if applicable) database as well as relevant documents such as job descriptions, collective bargaining agreements, and pay plans. I am able to send survey templates to assist with the data collection; however, we will accept data in the manner most convenient for you.

Staff Census Information requested:

Job Titles
Classification Title
Pay Grades
Pay Ranges (Minimum and Maximum)
Actual Salaries
Full-Time Equivalent (FTE) Status
Staff Handbook

I also kindly request answers to the following questions related to the compensation study:

How are salaries adjusted for your organization (e.g., COLA, Longevity, performance, etc.)?
What is your current turnover rate?
What is your current average tenure for an employee?
Date your current compensation plan was implemented.
Date of the last salary adjustment?
How frequently are job descriptions updated?

For the faculty database, I am requesting the following information:

Faculty Census:
Rank (if applicable)
Classification Title (if faculty holds other positions other than teaching such as Dean, Chair, Coordinators,etc)
Highest Degree Held
Pay Grade
Pay Ranges (Min& Max)
Current Step (if on a step plan)
Contract Length (in days and/or months)
Annual Base Salary with no additives
Annual Salary with any additives
Discipline (Not to be confused with department, the distinct/specific subject the faculty member teaches; Ex: Microbiology)
Department
CIP Code (if available - by individual incumbent)

Additionally, copies of the following documents, if available:

Copy of all faculty pay plans
Employee Benefit Information (Holidays Off, Health Insurance, Etc)
Salary Adjustment Policy (Longevity, performance, COLA, etc)
Any Collective Bargaining Agreements
Current Turnover Rate
Current Average Tenure
Date that your current pay plan was implemented
Date of your last salary adjustment to pay plan
How frequently are your job descriptions updated
Do you have a planned salary adjustment to your compensation structures for the next fiscal year? If so, by what amount?
Please list/attach and supplements/additives that faculty are compensated for duties outside of instruction
Faculty Handbooks
Adjunct Rates/Pay Plan
Overload Rates
Rates for compensation for faculty leadership- Deans, Coordinators, Department Chairs
Do you compensate faculty differently based on area of discipline? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have any form of additional compensation for Large Class Size? If yes, please provide details.
Do you have an education incentive at your institution? If yes, please provide details.

I understand that public records requests may involve administrative processes and associated fees, as allowed by law. Please inform me of any fees and the estimated timeframe for fulfilling this request. If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific legal grounds for the refusal.

Please consider this email as a formal request for public records under the applicable open records laws. If there are any questions or additional details needed to process this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

I look forward to your prompt attention to this matter and the timely provision of the requested information. Your cooperation in ensuring transparency and access to public records is greatly appreciated.

Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to mandatory exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive?: Yes
Do you agree to the redaction of information that is subject to discretionary exceptions, provided such redactions are clearly labeled on information you receive? Yes

Email: alisia@consultevergreen.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alisia Rios

On March 6, 2025 this office received your records request of March 6, 2025. In accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law, please accept this letter as acknowledgement of our receipt of that request.

A determination will be made, and access to the requested records will be made as applicable, in accordance with Article 6 of the New York Public Officers Law and any other controlling statutes within 20 business days.  There may be a fee of $.25 per page for duplication of the records requested, or in certain circumstances, a document preparation fee if the records are delivered electronically.
